intro: Nonatelia andamanica, commonly known as the Andaman sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the Andaman Islands. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or coastal soils and is adapted to the tropical climate of its native habitat. It has a taproot system and produces small, oval-shaped seeds that are dispersed by wind. Nonatelia andamanica is often found in disturbed or open habitats, such as beaches and dunes.
